bibl.title: Letter from Victor G. Heiser to Henry Rose Carter, February 9, 1925

div1.p: Heiser inquires whether Carter has seen an article on mosquito breeding in palm leaves.

div1.head: Letter from Victor G. Heiser to Henry Rose Carter, February 9, 1925
div1.opener:
J. H. B.
Heiser
ADMINISTRATIVE STAFF
----
FREDERICK F. RUSSELL, M.D.
GENERAL DIRECTOR
JOHN A. FERRELL, M.D.
DIRECTOR FOR
THE UNITED STATES
VICTOR G. HEISER, M.D.
DIRECTOR FOR
THE EAST
H. H. HOWARD, M.D.
DIRECTOR FOR
THE WEST INDIES
WILBUR A. SAWYER, M.D.
DIRECTOR OF PUBLIC HEALTH
LABORATORY SERVICE
MEMBERS
----
GEORGE E. VINCENT
CHAIRMAN
WALLACE BUTTRICK
DAVID L. EDSALL
JOHN G. FITZGERALD
SIMON FLEXNER
RAYMOND B. FOSDICK
EDWIN O. JORDAN
VERNON KELLOGG
JOHN D. ROCKEFELLER, JR.
WICKLIFFE ROSE
VICTOR C. VAUGHAN
WILLIAM H. WELCH
NORMA S. THOMPSON
SECRETARY
FLORENCE M. READ
ASSISTANT SECRETARY
INTERNATIONAL HEALTH BOARD
OF
THE ROCKEFELLER FOUNDATION
61 BROADWAY, NEW YORK
CABLE ADDRESS “INTERCOM”
February 9, 1925
Dear Dr. Carter:
div1.p:
While on the train last week I read with
much interest the reprint entitled “Preferential
and Compulsory Breeding Places of Aedes (Stegomyia)
aegypti and their Limits”, which you so kindly gave
me during my visit. You seem to be just a trifle
skeptical with regard to the reported breeding of
stegomyia in Africa in other than man-made containers.
In this connection, I wonder whether you saw the article
entitled “Mosquitoes and Coconut Palms - A Mosquito
Survey of Palm Trees in East Africa and the Problems
Resulting Therefrom” by W.E. Haworth, which appeared
in the Transactions of the Royal Society of Tropical
Medicine and Hygiene, Vol. XVIII, No. 4, October 23,
Dr. H.R. Carter
- 2 -
February 9, 1925
1924. This article does not mention the aegypti, but
other stegomyia are listed as breeding abundantly in
the leaves of coconut trees.

It was a great pleasure as well as a most stim-
ulating experience to see you again. I hope that you
will soon be able to be out.

With cordial good wishes to you and Laura,
I am,
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, Victor G. Heiser Dr. H.R. Carter,
2122 California St., N.W.,
Washington, D.C.
VGH:FQ
